modules.description: Provides functions to create and manage trace spans with automatic scope tracking, including creating resource spans, emitting spans to a collector, and defining scoped operations that inherit context. Works with span and scope types from the Opentelemetry module, using key-value attributes and trace identifiers. Used to instrument code for distributed tracing, ensuring spans are correctly nested and attributed within an ambient execution context.

Provides functions to create and aggregate numeric metrics, including gauge values, summed totals, and histogram data points with customizable attributes and timestamps. Works with timestamp types, attribute lists, and OpenTelemetry protocol buffers for metric data. Used to track real-time system performance, aggregate user behavior metrics, and generate detailed statistical distributions for monitoring.

The module offers functions for constructing and serializing OpenTelemetry log structures, including log records, resource logs, and scope logs, with support for Protocol Buffers encoding and pretty-printing. It works with types like `log_record`, `logs_data`, and `log_record_flags`, enabling structured telemetry data handling and instrumentation. Use cases include logging instrumentation, distributed tracing integration, and formatted log entry generation for observability pipelines.

Provides functions for creating and managing traces, spans, and metrics, with support for exporting data to OpenTelemetry backends. Works with types such as context, span, and metric instruments to track application behavior. Used to integrate distributed tracing and monitoring into server applications, enabling visibility into request flows and performance.

Provides functions for distributed tracing, metric aggregation, and log serialization, enabling comprehensive telemetry collection. It handles trace spans with context tracking, numeric metrics with attributes and timestamps, and structured log records with protocol buffers. Operations include creating spans, emitting metrics, and serializing logs for observability pipelines. Used to instrument applications for performance monitoring, user behavior analysis, and distributed system debugging.
